model_answer: I would select A, B, C, and D because each of these events builds upon the previous ones and contributed to the creation of the World Championships of Rock Paper Scissors.

Answer: A/B/C/D
All four events contributed to building the scale and visibility needed to reach the Guinness World Records 2008 entry for the “Largest Rock, Paper, Scissors Contest.”

Event 3: Launching the World Championships supported by membership and merchandise sales, with visuals of membership cards, a trophy, and media outlets, helped increase interest and participation in the game.
Event 4: Expanding exposure through an official strategy guide, an award-winning documentary, international champions, and even choosing between Fox and ESPN for TV rights, further elevated the game's profile and credibility.
Event 2: Establishing the game’s culture and strategy via a website and named gambits also played a crucial role in creating a dedicated fanbase and promoting the rules and objectives of the game.
Event 6: The high-stakes “Sotheby’s vs. Christie’s” $12M match brought significant media coverage and attention to the game, solidifying its status as a major competitive sport.
